meanings.definition: The quality or state of being voluntary.
meanings.sent1: Her voluntarinesses in helping others is truly admirable.
meanings.sent2: The voluntarinesses of his actions showed his true character.
meanings.sent3: She displayed her voluntarinesses by offering to assist without being asked.
meanings.sent4: His voluntarinesses shone brightly in the community like a guiding light.
meanings.sent5: The voluntarinesses of her decision left a lasting impression on everyone.

meanings.definition: The act of doing something willingly or without being forced.
meanings.sent1: Their voluntarinesses to participate in the project made it a success.
meanings.sent2: Voluntarinesses in charity work can make a significant impact on society.
meanings.sent3: The voluntarinesses of the children to share their toys was heartwarming.
meanings.sent4: Her voluntarinesses in joining the team added a new dynamic to their efforts.
meanings.sent5: The voluntarinesses of his smile brightened up the room instantly.

meanings.definition: The state of being done by choice or free will.
meanings.sent1: The voluntarinesses of her decision to travel alone surprised her friends.
meanings.sent2: Voluntarinesses in making important choices can lead to personal growth.
meanings.sent3: His voluntarinesses to try new foods led to some interesting culinary adventures.
meanings.sent4: The voluntarinesses of his actions reflected his independent nature.
meanings.sent5: Choosing to pursue his passion showed great voluntarinesses.
